After a great deal of discussion and consultation with several outside agencies, we are happy to announce Graduation (including awards night) will take place at Mid Peninsula School Friday, June 19, 2020 at 6:00 p.m.

The plan is for the ceremony to take place inside the gymnasium with appropriate social distancing and 5 guests per senior. We will have the seniors in chairs spread out and they will have the opportunity to walk across the stage and receive their diploma like in years past. If for some reason we are unable to have the ceremony inside, we will set up a tent and stage outside and have it on the west end of the school. If you have any questions don't hesitate to contact me at evandamme@mpswolverines.com

Thank you for your patience during these unprecedented times!! Go Wolverines!!

post_text:
Student of the Week: Shelbie Soderman

Shelbie Soderman is a junior at Mid Pen. She’s a helper and a hard worker. She’s the type of student who, in preparing for class, independently takes notes on the themes and settings for each chapter in the assigned book. And then shares her findings with her classmates. Shelbie believes in community and caring for others. As an active member in 4H she has been raising and showing pigs for the past seven years. In that time her pigs have been the lightweight champion, the heavyweight champion, and the grand champion of the U.P. State Fair. She has also been given the Reserve Showmanship award. Through 4H Shelbie has learned that animals deserve the same love and respect as people (pigs are smarter than dogs, after all), and in the future she wants to become a 4H leader so that she can model those ideals for other kids. For Shelbie, working hard and helping others isn’t so special, it’s simply an intrinsic part of life. And that’s what makes her so special.

Student of the Week: Dylan Trudell

As sure as day turns to night and back into day again, Dylan Trudell will always be working hard to reach his goals and achieve success. A senior at Mid Pen, Dylan is more reliable than death and taxes. He’s the tortoise, not the hare: for him “slow and steady” wins the race. And win the race, he does. Nothing ever goes unfinished with Dylan, and tasks are completed with with diligence and fastidious care. (It’s no co-incidence that “Dylan” and “diligence” sound alike.) His friends call him The Science Genius and have dubbed him the shoe-tying champion of the world. A selfless friend and student, Dylan frequently volunteers his time and talents to those in need of assistance. Need a ride to school? He’s your guy. Having a pancake breakfast and need someone to wash dishes? Call Dylan. In trouble with the Republic and need someone to assume your identity? He is Spartacus! Yeah, he’s that good. He’s that kinda guy.

Student of the week Kennedy Englund

Kennedy Englund is a leader and competitor, a student who never stands down when she knows the fight is right. Always the honor roll student, she props up her academic achievements on the court as the captain for Mid Pen’s varsity volleyball and basketball teams. (not to mention, she can throw a scorching dodgeball when necessary.) Kennedy “never wants to be like anyone else,” and she not only walks that walk, but talks that talk as well. Literally. A strong communicator, she serves as a mentor to younger students, nurturing their confidence through her infectious positive attitude and encouragement. Even her sister describes her as being “productive” and a good leader; and in a world rife with sibling rivalry, that’s superlative praise indeed. In terms of her future plans, Kennedy is a Smash Mouth “All Star” who hopes to get her game on and go play basketball for the Norse next year where she will begin her studies to become a surgical nurse. Her world’s on fire, how about yours? That’s the way Kennedy likes it and she never gets bored.

Student of the Week: Camryn Croasdell

Camryn is a student par excellence, and one may as well posit an answer to why a raven is like a writing desk as attempt to create a comprehensive list of her accomplishments and activities thus far. As a senior, Camryn carries around her 3.94 gpa as if it’s just another thing to put in her backpack, no more impressive than any other book, badge. or honor she’s got stowed away in there. That’s because she expects excellence of herself; therefore when she reaches it, it’s nothing but normal. When preeminent students play three sports, she does four; while they accrue high scores, she sets high school records. For Camryn, it’s not enough to do four years of high school. She’s doing a fifth, through the EMC program with Bay College. And while others go on to study ultrasounds, she intends to pursue “sonography.” It’s even been told that while hunting with her father, she once shot two deer with a single bullet. But that’s gotta be a rumor, right? Maybe not. This is Camryn Croasdell, after all, and that is a feat one might expect from her.

Student of the week

Hailey Derocher is a rock star in intellect and appearance, in style and smarts. Through Lennon’s specs she adopts Dylan’s ideology. She plies her brain with books and music and math and all forms of information, academic or otherwise, until her wisdom and wit are honed into a highly efficient, double-edged tool used for eradicating ignorance and furthering her efforts toward achieving a new world order of the Literati. Hailey is held in equally high regard by both her teachers and classmates. The former expect her to be the apogee of curricular standards, and the latter model themselves after her peerless examples. She is an exemplary student whose learning comes as a matter of choice rather than circumstance, and someday, after she has deftly danced her way through Bay College, she will make a very fine chiropractor indeed.
